name: Siamese
overview: The Siamese is one of the oldest and most recognizable cat breeds, known for their striking blue eyes, distinctive color points, and extremely vocal nature.
health: Generally healthy but can be prone to dental issues.

name: Maine Coon
overview: Maine Coons are one of the largest domestic cat breeds, known for their impressive size, tufted ears, bushy tails, and friendly disposition.
care: Regular brushing required for their long coat.
bestFor: Families with children and other pets.
health: Can be prone to hip dysplasia.

name: Persian
overview: Persians are known for their luxurious long coats, flat faces, and calm demeanor. They're the epitome of a lap cat.
care: Daily grooming essential to prevent matting.
health: Prone to breathing difficulties and eye conditions.

name: Sphynx
overview: The Sphynx is instantly recognizable by their lack of fur, wrinkled skin, and large ears. Don't let their unusual appearance fool you‚Äîthey're one of the most affectionate breeds.
care: Weekly bathing required to remove oil buildup on skin.
bestFor: Active households who want constant companionship.
health: Generally healthy but sensitive to temperature extremes.

name: Bengal
overview: Bengals have a distinctive wild appearance with their leopard-like spots and muscular build. They're highly active and intelligent.
care: Needs lots of exercise and mental stimulation.
bestFor: Active families who can provide enrichment.

name: Ragdoll
overview: Ragdolls earned their name from their tendency to go limp when picked up. They're large, gentle cats with striking blue eyes.
care: Regular brushing 2-3 times per week required.
bestFor: Families with children and first-time cat owners.
health: Can develop heart disease and kidney issues.

name: British Shorthair
overview: British Shorthairs are known for their round faces, dense coats, and calm temperament. They're independent yet affectionate.
care: Minimal grooming needs, weekly brushing sufficient.
bestFor: Busy professionals or seniors wanting a low-maintenance companion.
health: Generally healthy but watch for weight gain.

name: Scottish Fold
overview: Scottish Folds are instantly recognizable by their unique folded ears. They're sweet-natured and adaptable cats.
care: Regular ear cleaning needed due to folded ears.
bestFor: Families wanting a gentle, sociable cat.
health: Prone to cartilage issues, regular vet checkups essential.

name: Russian Blue
overview: Russian Blues are known for their shimmering blue-grey coat and striking green eyes. They're intelligent and somewhat shy.
bestFor: Quiet households and people who respect boundaries.
health: Very healthy breed with few genetic issues.

name: Abyssinian
overview: Abyssinians are one of the oldest cat breeds, known for their ticked coat and extremely active, playful nature.
care: Needs lots of play and climbing opportunities.
bestFor: Active families who can provide entertainment.
health: Generally healthy but can develop dental issues.

name: Birman
overview: Birmans are beautiful cats with striking blue eyes, color-point coats, and distinctive white 'gloves' on their paws.
care: Regular brushing to prevent matting of silky coat.
bestFor: Families wanting an affectionate, gentle companion.

name: Exotic Shorthair
overview: Exotic Shorthairs have the Persian's flat face and sweet personality but with a short, plush coat that's easier to maintain.
care: Minimal grooming compared to Persians, weekly brushing.
bestFor: Those who love Persians but want easier grooming.
health: Similar health concerns to Persians (breathing, eyes).
